name: City View - Sarah's double room.
description:
A good sized room with a comfy double bed and views across Bristol. Wander to the local park in the morning, pop to the harbourside to explore for the day and head to the local in the evening!

The space
The room is in an old Victorian house and has views across Bristol to the famous Suspension Bridge. This looks fantastic at night with all the lights.

The bathroom has a bath only (there is a shower attachment but it is not very powerful), but there is lots of hot water and bubble bath. There is a table and chair in the room as well as hanging space.

The house is very homely; it's more very relaxed and shabby chic than perfection. There a quite a few walk books for the area that you are welcome to borrow.

I live in the house and may well be there when you stay. I am away a lot of weekends, but generally there in the weeks.

Guest access
Guest's have access to the kitchen and the bathroom is also shared with
neighborhood_overview:
The neighbourhood is friendly and welcoming; most houses are Victorian like mine, but the ones opposite are old miners cottages from the 1860's.

Much of community life centres around Victoria Park which is a large lovely green space at the end of my road. It has a children's play area, a lovely little café that you can dash to for bacon sarnies in the morning and great views across Bristol.

There is a city farm a few minutes walk away as well and a meander into the centre of Bristol takes you through the park and you can choose to go easily along the harbourside to see the best of beautiful Bristol.
host_about: I am pretty laid back, enjoy meeting new people and having my house lived in by anyone who comes to stay, love being out in the wilds with a tent or out walking, swing dance fanatic, and nearly always have a good Malbec open. Love a good unicorn! I work in the charity and childcare sector.

name: City Centre-Waterside Retreat
description:
My Harbourside apartment centrally located minutes from Bristol and Clifton offers a peaceful respite along the water.
A large double bedroom and open plan living room await your arrival. Amenities include shower and onsite gym and sauna.
Virgin 300mb Fiber Broadband.Apple Tv in Bedroom.
The fee for three or more guests is £300 per night (plus Airbnb fees).

The space
A quiet, serene apartment in Bristol city center along the waterside. This two bedroom apartment compromises a shared living room, kitchen and dining room.
As a guest you have(URL HIDDEN)a. Large private bedroom with a brand new mattres(URL HIDDEN)b. Your own private en-suite with rain shower(URL HIDDEN)c. Off street parkin(URL HIDDEN)d. Wireless Internet throughout(URL HIDDEN)e. Laundry facilitie(URL HIDDEN)f. Use of kitchen, living and dining room.

My own Master Bedroom can be rented out thus allowing four guests to use the whole apartment. The fee for three or more
neighborhood_overview:
This area is on the water and has splendid views of the S.S. Great Britain.
This neighborhood has plenty of local amenities; bars, restaurants and shops.
host_about: Living in Bristol since 2007, I am an architect with a passion for traveling and meeting new people. Let me make you welcome in my waterside apartment while you visit exciting Bristol.

name: The White Room -  Central Bristol Art House Garden
description:
A small double room in an artist's house, with North Street indy culture, bars and shops on the doorstep. Nestled on a quiet street just next to the action. Enjoy breakfast in the garden. 17 minutes' walk from the centre of Bristol / 2 minutes from the bus stop.

The space
Private room in a characterful cottage / artist studio. Great central location.

I work as an artist/designer, and the house is full of interesting and beautiful things I've collected from the UK and travels in South America and Asia.

The White Room has a small double bed and an airbed, it can accommodate 1 or 2 people.

There is on-street parking nearby and a free carpark; unrestricted at weekends.

Guest access
Fully equipped kitchen & bathroom.
Living Room.
Dining room most of the time.
Front & back gardens.
neighborhood_overview:
Southville is pretty darn hip, frankly. North Street is bustling with bars, restaurants, quirky shops and culture. Huge murals and street art cover most buildings, thanks to the annual Street Art festival, Upfest. The Tobacco Factory Theatre hosts plays, comedy, classes and a great weekly market. There's lots of green spaces, even a City Farm within 15 minutes. The house is next to two high streets with plenty of independent shops, but it's on a quiet lane so it's peaceful too.

5-10min walk:
Loads of Murals/Street Art, Vintage/Retro shops & bars, Buddhist Centre, old fashioned Swimming Baths, City Farm.

15 min-25 min walk:
Tobacco Factory Theatre, M-shed Museum, Thekla boat-nightclub, Nelson Street graffitti, Banksy trail... Ashton Court Estate - a lovely walk and great for deer!
host_about:
That photo is about 10 years old, I'll change it in a minute.

I'm an Art Technician, lecturer and sometime self-employed graphic designer, which occasionally leaves time for making, dancing, rantingq about Tories etc. I like meeting new people, live music, cats, sci-fi, tea...

I now host with my partner Tom, who is great at cryptic crosswords and also works in education, previously journalism. He can't dance  but he likes a good board game.

Tom and I speak some Spanish and have mostly forgotten how to speak French, German and Japanese, but can stumble through a conversation if prompted :)

name: 'The Sunset Room' Peaceful, Clear Home
description:
Close to Bristol and Bath Railway Path, leading to Bath and Bristol City Centre: Bike, walk or bus ride. Local train station connects to Bristol Temple Mead Station & elsewhere. Excellent grocery stores, great cafes & eateries, friendly pubs. Set in a quiet residential backwater, close to parks & green walking spaces with quick and easy access to the city. Free on street parking. You’ll love my place for its cosiness, location, and people. Couples, solo adventurers, business travellers welcome.

The space
Please DO NOT MAKE a RESERVATION before discussing with me. Also, I do not have the facilities for guests traveling from abroad who need to quarantine.

Two peaceful rooms available under separate listings,

This listing offers 'The Lilac Room' provides a very peaceful double bedroom on the first floor, overlooking the back garden.
This room boasts beautiful natural light, a large modern streamline desk with storage for admin or anythi
neighborhood_overview: Located in the cosmopolitan and bohemian community of Greenbank, Easton. Excellent local food shops that sell a wide range of quality foods, cool cafe's and restaurants, providing a range of different cultural cuisine, ie Thali, Moroccan, Indian, Vegan, great coffee at Cafe 5 etc. Good public transport service provides a short ride to city center and other surrounding areas .. A local train service within walking distance trains to: Temple Meads Train Station, Clifton, Redland, Gloucester rd and Bath etc. Plus bus services.  The Bristol to Bath railway path, is great for both cyclists and pedestrians and is right on our doorstep. Green spaces and lovely parks in walking distance.
host_about: So far I've really enjoyed the experience of hosting the varied and interesting selection of people who have visited my home. I'm calm and friendly, respectful, easy to get along with person. When I travel, I like to stay in places that offer me privacy and space but helpful and friendly if I need anything. I like a clean, clear space, that I can call my own, so I aim to offer the same to my guests, I'm also open to a friendly chat and cuppa if you need that. I'm told people feel relaxed and at ease in my company. I am well traveled including time spent in West Africa and Europe. I've lived in Central and South America and the Caribbean. I love the arts and culture, I'm a practicing writer, photographer and therapist. I love music and dancing and for many years I worked alongside world music artists, working and traveling with artists from all over the world; I think this has given me a broad understanding, appreciation and acceptance of different people and different customs. I relate well to others and am told by people who have limited grasp of the english language that my spoken english and diction is clear and easy to understand. I speak a little spanglish! I like walking, nature and yoga.

name: Listed Georgian house in the heart of Bristol.
description:
This is a unique home in the heart of Montpelier in the heart of Bristol. Comfortable and wild around the edges this house is intriguing and loves to be explored. Although Honeybottom is in central Bristol its peaceful and restful here. The garden is a little green haven in a world of graffiti, stone and concrete whilst being surrounded by some of the best out and aboutings that Bristol has to offer.
Come and stay x
P.s Check out Charlotte Gainsbourg's self directed video for Ring a Roses.....

The space
(This is a residential area and the house is not detached, so in line with pub law: No 'Noise' outside after 11pm please. Only the number of people booked and paid for can use the house at any one time.)

This is a unique house in the heart of Montpelier. I chose him because he was a happy house with a good vibe and because the garden had a miniture woodland. He has been renovated sympathetically and is full of magic and character and a life s
neighborhood_overview: Shabby and authentic and still not gentrified, loads of tagging and rows of Georgian townhouses. This was the market garden for old Bristol and is now a mishmash of the old-timers and the newcomers. Its got a village vibe, some great pubs ( the star and garter; Bristol's Gold) great eats and enough shops not to need a supermarket. Infamous now famous cool neighbourhood.
host_about: profffessssional faery. Love nature; no one can do it better. Love twists and turns. Love dancing. Spend a lot of time gazing; a lot of it at the same thing. When I travel I dont do it by the book.

name: Cosy large room nr TV studios, Paintworks & stores
description:
A room with a shared bathroom in a Victorian terraced house - expect creaky floorboards and doors.

You have a minifridge, kettle and microwave in your room. Please note that at this time that the main kitchen and lounge are out of use for guests.

It has easy access by car (on-street parking only) and bus. Breakfast isn't provided as we're next door to Sainsbury's supermarket.

I work from home so ask that you're out during working hours as my office is next to the spare room.

The space
Please check out the "About Me" section.

Please share something about yourself too since you will be staying in my home. Bookings without a profile photo or "about you" may be declined as I may not feel safe in my own home without knowing something about you.
host_about:
I rent rooms out in my home in Bristol. I'm a self employed freelance travel content marketer and PR copywriter and during the pandemic I was hit hard so I now rent 2 of my spare rooms. 

I'm in my mid 50s and have done the partying so now am an early to bed, early to rise person and  love going to bed early with a good book  I always aim for 8 hours sleep. I try to fit in gym classes daily, and  meditate regularly.

I like to keep a clean and tidy home (and hope if you're staying with me you would respect that and keep it clean/ check my house rules).

name: home from home, large double, light
description:
quiet household, slightly whacky but always friendly and homely.

WOMEN ONLY bookings please

private room - this is not a room shared with others, not a hostel but your own private room!

The space
WOMEN ONLY GUESTS PLEASE!!!!!!
Large room with small double bed, bright and airy, overlooking garden, use of kitchen, large garden, in very quiet household.
Only 1-2 minutes walk to bus number 1 which goes straight to the city centre.
5 minutes walk to very large nature reserve - so you get both the city and the country in one.
Happy to collect you from the airport for a fee (£16 one way)
Women only guests please!!!
WOMEN ONLY GUESTS PLEASE!!!!!!
Smoking permitted only in the garden (bus shelter kind of smoking shelter provided)
Other than that a happy, laid back atmosphere with easy going surroundings
This is a basic but very friendly household.
I provide maps of Bristol and can give you some ti
neighborhood_overview: very quiet neighbourhood, Co-op shop 1-2 minutes walk away with long opening hours
host_about:
I am laid back, very friendly, easy going and appreciate meeting different people and offering them a home from home.  I am considerate and very quiet and expect my guests to also be considerate of others around them.
Access to the kitchen for light cooking, dining room and of course the garden is available.

I like to meet up with friends, walk in the nature reserve 2 minutes walk from my house, do calligraphy, am politically aware and active, like to sing, gardening and baking delicious yummy cakes - 
for a small additonal fee I will provide very good home cooked meals/piece of home baked cake :)
happy to collect from airport or railway station for a reasonable fee.  
Full use of the garden while you are here, wi-fi internet access

name: Historic Trym House - five star!
description:
We actually have up to 4 rooms available with various combinations of accommodation options. Please get in touch if you have specific requests.

The space
En Suite double bedroom on beautiful top floor of historic house with fantastic views of old Westbury on Trym - large, beautifully decorated double bedroom, delightful ensuite bathroom, separate room for relaxing, reading etc. Minutes from Bristol - so much to see and do. Excellent public transport. Ample off street parking. Breakfast included - help yourself to cereal, toast, fruit etc. and Tea or Coffee. Happy to offer some evening meals, negotiable seperately. But plenty of excellent eateries within 5 mins walk. A five star English Heritage listed property, offering lovely and unique accommodation at half the price or less of an equivalent hotel - with an infinitely more personal welcome.

If there are more than two of you, there is a delightful single room next to the main guest bedroom, but this w
host_about: Married couple, 55 yrs, kids off to uni etc., we are madly well travelled (80+ countries)

name: Bristol Luxury Garden Apartment
description:
The space
This is a sunny, light high ceilinged apartment on the garden level of this impressive Grade 2 listed 200 year old Georgian house set on a hill in Montpelier, Bristol. The owner lives on the top 2 levels of the property. The apartment has its own side door at the bottom of the side steps (with iron handrail) with access to a south facing terrace overlooking the garden. The terrace is for sole use of the apartment and access
to the garden is allowed if there are children staying (there is a 2 metre drop down to the vegetable patch at the end of the garden so young ones will need to be supervised for safety)
This is ideal for 2 people but there is a new full size double super comfy sofa bed (a proper thick mattress 140cm X 190cm) in the living room which has a really comfy thick mattress on it and has had excellent feedback for comfort (available for £20 per person per night). There is also a new solid fold out bed. There is a large travel cot available
host_about:
Hi my name is Ingrid,

I am a freelancer arty person who works in the media. 

I look forward to welcoming you to my home.
Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions regrading my apartment.

name: Your Bristol weekend hideaway
description:
My cool and comfortable flat has a spare room for guests that fits up to 2 people and is centrally located in very convenient area in Bristol with lots of facilities, supermarkets, restaurants, bars.. It has become a trendy area in the last 5 years.

The space
The flat is tidy and cosy.
The guest room although is usually laid as a single can be also twin or double to accommodate two.
My guests enjoy their own bathroom and wifi.
No meals offered but there are plenty of cafes we can highly recommend in the area.
Close to the centre, less than ten minutes walk and also plenty of bus links to travel to other parts of the city. Parking is in my road, car owners can either park car in the road or nearby parking areas.
Lots of public transport links closeby.
Close to shops and the city centre malls such as the popular Cabot Circus. My area has become a trendy and artistic one.
I am an experienced and devoted host, i love hosting and
neighborhood_overview: This is an inner urban area with convenient links to the city centre retail, employment and services as well as to health care.  It is a complex urban area with strong well defined character areas, illustrating a layering of different ages of development and use from 19th century terraced residential properties through larger business and commercial buildings, through elegant squares and open spaces to the post war public sector environment of St Paul’s itself.  Topographically the area is largely flat close to the centre but the northern areas of Montpelier have more interest in topographical terms.
host_about:
i am a professional woman with various occupations and hobbies.I am an experienced host.. I started hosting overseas students which i did successfully working with a particular school. 
I like to regard myself as a nurturer, i love making people happy and comfortable. I have earned a reputation as a good cook..

I have two lovely dogs, Benji and Dudley, both very playful and happy dogs.  
I am a professional dog walker. I am happy to show my guests the lovely local parks where we walk  if they have the time. 

 I am in a relationship with Tris, who also has got a dog called Flea, both spend weekends with us. 

I speak Catalan, Spanish, English, Italian and I can mumble French.

I do love music and play the cello and listen to classical music mainly, making my home a very relaxing place to live in.

name: Modern inner city 3 bed eco house
description:
The space
Architecturally significant and award winning eco house one mile from Bristol City Centre situated in the leafy suburb of Redland. The self contained property is well equipped, sleeping up to five people comfortably. There is ample secure off street parking accessed down the private drive shared with the main house in an historic and rural setting in the curtilage of the old farm. The property enjoys underfloor heating throughout, triple glazing, air circulation/exchange system.and insulation up to the highest standards. There is one double bedroom with en suite wet room, one twin bedded room with separate bathroom and a sleeping area upstairs. There is no smoking allowed throughout the property.

The property is a 10 minute walk from the bustling Whiteladies Road, Clifton and Durdham Down and 10 minutes from the thriving Gloucester Road and one mile from the city centre (Cabot Circus, Park Street and Harbourside). There are excellent bus services g
host_about: Hi, my husband and I have lived in Bristol for 35 years and are able to advise on local facilities and recommend places of interest for you to visit. We are widely travelled and have an appreciation of home from home comforts. We have brought up our two children here while working and renovating this idyllic retreat. We welcome you to join us in this unusual sylvan setting and welcome suggestions to make your stay even more comfortable.

name: Central Double Room With Your Own Bathroom
description:
Situated in the heart of Bristol, only 5minutes walk to Cabot Circus (the main shopping area), all the shops, restaurants and night life, 10 minutes walk to the train station and 20 minutes to the airport (by car).

We offer a large double room which has a double bed, desk with chair, chest of drawers and super comfy armchair although the room has no wardrobe. You will have exclusive use of the bathroom as we have an en-suite, the bathroom consists of a bath with shower.

The space
Situated in the heart of Bristol, only 5minutes walk to Cabot Circus (the main shopping area), all the shops, restaurants and night life, 10 minutes walk to the train station and 20 minutes to the airport (by car).

There is paid parking on the street outside our apartment but it's free one street down.

We are a gay couple and as such you would need to be liberal minded.

The apartment has two bedrooms one of which is mine and my partners.
host_about: We love to travel and meet people from different countries and cultures. We are very sociable, down to earth and easy to get on with.

name: Edwardian house in central Bristol
description:
You will stay in the master room in our home, with a very comfortable kingsize bed in a semi detached Edwardian house, its close to the center, yet situated in a quiet location away from the busy part of the city, but close enough to eat in trendy and interesting areas of Bristol. Please note...our neighborhood now has residential parking, if you are bringing a car you will require parking permits at £2 per day.

The space
Cath and Patrick invite you to stay in their home in a quiet street close to the centre of the city. We live in an elegant Edwardian three storey house in the heart of Bristol. Its position is fantastically convenient for the centre which is a 10 minute walk away, the harbour side cafes and bars are 5mins walk away. You will stay in our master room ( cosy single room on other site) both of which have just been newly refurbished .

Bristol Temple Meads Station is about 15-20 mins to walk and we are 30 mins by car from Bristol Airport
host_about: We are from Bristol and love to travel and experience other cultures. We enjoy the great outdoors and have a camper van. We are easy to please and appreciate the simple things in life.

name: Clifton Village, superfast internet, car permits
description:
A self-contained spacious 1 bedroom flat (own entrance) on West Mall, Clifton Village. Visitor car parking permits included. Superfast broadband 200MB. 4- poster kingsized bed with new 2-person sofa bed in the lounge. Travel cots & high chair. There is an Amazon Echo, underfloor heating in bathroom, a fully fitted kitchen, 40" Flatscreen Smart 3D LED TV with built-in WiFi, and a Nespresso coffeemaker. 2mins from Clifton Suspension Bridge and The Ivy Brasserie Clifton, in central Clifton Village.

The space
A beautifully presented spacious 1 double bedroom flat on West Mall, in the heart of Clifton Village (BS8 4BH). This luxurious basement flat is fully furnished and recently refurbished to a high standard. The area has a residential parking scheme - please ask if you need a permit for your car.
Close to restaurants, bars, shops, the Clifton Suspension Bridge, M4 and M5 motorways, train and bus stations. Late check out is available if there are no bookings f
neighborhood_overview: We are in the heart of leafy Clifton Village. There are boutique shops, restaurants and coffee shops just 2 minutes away from the apartment.
host_about: I live in Bristol with my husband and two children and we've got this beautifully presented and spacious 1 double bedroom flat in the heart of Clifton Village.

name: Luxury Double En Suite Bedroom
description:
The space
Set in the heart of bustling Bristol is a luxury double bedroom with en-suite bathroom.

Andy & Claire have lived in this sumptuous open plan apartment for over 10 years and are pleased to offer a double room for overnight stays.

The apartment boasts easy access to both Temple Meads train station and the Bristol International Airport (10 minute cab ride to the station, twenty to the airport). It is also five minutes walk from North Street, with a range of shops and fine restaurants.

Claire and Andy are looking for those interested in staying for 1-2 nights. Casual stays, business trips and those wishing to fly via the Airport are all welcome.

With a light, relaxed atmosphere and the offer of home cooked food (additional cost), this should be top of your list for overnight stays in Bristol.

Bus stop taking you into City centre or train station 2 minutes away.

Situated opposite one of Bristols nices
host_about: Outgoing and personable with a love of music and food. Andy and Claire has shared this wonderful space together for over 10 years.

name: Large double room with breakfast
description:
This is a very friendly house. So it's a home away from home.
You'll find the house clean and tidy with all local aminities and a park is within walking distance.

There is an excellent bus service to the city centre, running every 10 minutes.

My partner is Spanish, so English and Spanish is spoken in the house.

The space
The house is situated in a quiet part of Bristol. Nearby, you will be able to take advantage of the regular bus service to the city centre. There are supermarkets, many other shops & even a park within walking distance from the house, so you'll have easy access to all the requirements.

The house is a semi-detached property with three full bedrooms. The room in which you'll be staying is spacious and has been recently decorated.

There are no children or pets in the house. This is a non-smoking house. However if you are a smoker you may smoke outside.

You will have a shared bathroom, as
host_about:
I'm an easy going, fun loving person. I like travelling & getting to know other cultures.I enjoy the outdoors, and nature.

My hobbies include Photography, Watch & Clock repairing and DIY.
Going to the cinema & theatre is something I enjoy very much.

I keep fit by going to the gym three times a week.  I also play Badminton & Tennis,

name: Cosy Single Bedroom in Southville
description:
A comfortable single bed/room with small desk and drawers.

The space
Cath and Patrick invite you to stay in their home in a quiet street close to the centre of the city. We live in an elegant Edwardian three storey house in the heart of Bristol. Its position is fantastically convenient for the centre which is a 10 minute walk away. You will stay in our single room which has just been newly refurbished. (We also have a Kingsize double room available advertised on another listing).

Bristol Temple Meads Station is about 15-20 mins to walk and we are 30 mins by car from Bristol Airport. (Cars can be parked here outside for free and buses go very regularly from outside the train station). Theatres, Arts Cinema and the Colston hall are all within a short walk away as is the SS Great Britain, the M-Shed Museum and The City Hall. The BBC is 15 mins by bike or a bus ride away. Many excellent Cafes and restaurants are within easy walking distance. We are also co
host_about: We are from Bristol and love to travel and experience other cultures. We enjoy the great outdoors and have a camper van. We are easy to please and appreciate the simple things in life.

name: BnB in Barn with 2 ensuite Bedrooms
description:
The space
The Barn has a "retro/rustic/bunk house character" with exposed beams some dating from the Napoleonic Wars. It has two bedrooms (one with a double bed and the other has two single beds of which one is on long legs!), both have en-suite wet rooms and lead off the large living/play area. Sheets and towels are included. The kitchen area in the main room comprises an electric cooker, butler's sink, microwave, refrigerator with small freezer section, kettle and toaster, utensils and crockery. Complimentary beverages, breakfast cereals, eggs mostly from our own hens, homemade bread, jam and cake, milk and bacon are provided to kick start your stay. There is a full size table tennis table and bar football for the young at heart! The sitting area is around a cast iron wood burning stove has a digital TV with SKY and an Ikea sofa which makes up into a full size single bed. Background heating is provided by a state of the art computer controlled electric panel system and th
host_about: Hi, my husband and I have lived in Bristol for 35 years and are able to advise on local facilities and recommend places of interest for you to visit. We are widely travelled and have an appreciation of home from home comforts. We have brought up our two children here while working and renovating this idyllic retreat. We welcome you to join us in this unusual sylvan setting and welcome suggestions to make your stay even more comfortable.

name: Double room in quiet LGBTQIA+ friendly home
neighborhood_overview:
We live in a quite suburban neighbourhood which is tranquil and spacious. There are parks nearby and access to local amenities such as supermarkets, shops and transport. If your stay is in the warmer months, you will be able to enjoy the garden also - and you may even get some home grown fruit and veg!
(Please note we are not in central Bristol!)
host_about:
Hi!
I love hosting and have done so for several years. Meeting new people and making them feel welcome and comfortable is a treat!
My interest in people extends to my work - I teach yoga and am a trauma therapist. I run my therapy business from home so this may limit your accessibility to the kitchen during the daytime - no problem if you are at work!
 You may find me practicing yoga while you stay - often in the garden in the summer months.
My husband is often away working as a choreographer in the USA, so when you stay it may be me or both of us here but I will let you know.
I have a BFA in Dance, and used to live and work in Holland and New York City. I have studied business, philosophy, creative writing and love learning.
I am looking forward to hosting you - please get in touch!
#ashley4yoga
@ashley4yoga

name: Clifton Towers Bristol B and B
description:
the accommodation suits single or double occupancy an extra bed can be added for a third person, the tariff changes accordingly. Large ground floor double bedroom with en-suite shower room. Victorian house your room has a bay window looking at a garden and many trees. We provide breakfast food, in your room for you to help yourselves. Restaurants bars shops Suspension Bridge and more near!

The space
One room bed and breakfast, with an en-suite shower room. The room is in an Victorian House, on the ground floor. It Is a beautiful large room with a double bed and a 3' single bed. Normally the single bed is not in the room. If you would like not to share a bed, then I can erect the 3’ single for a small fee of £5.00.
It has a breakfast bar with: a fridge, kettle, toaster and microwave. I provide the breakfast food which you prepare in the privacy of the room. It is also possible to use these facilities for making light evening meals.
The r
neighborhood_overview: Clifton is a place I moved to with my family in 1978.  It has always been a friendly place with a large variety of  people.  Students who keep it lively. Families whose children attend the 3 or 4 primary schools in the area.  Professional people running architects practises, artists, gardeners, plenty of musicians,and many women who run businesses.  It has always felt to me like a special place where things happen.  As there are loads of restaurants and café's, bars, woman and men's clothes shops, Bristol's amazing ZOO, the Camera Obscura on the Downs, the Avon Gorge (with protected and unique plants and birds) there are as you can see lots of place to go and see.  The major one I leave till last - The Suspension Bridge.  I can genuinely only enthuse about my neighbourhood.
host_about: I very much enjoy being a host.  Meeting people from far off or near keeps me in touch with the world!! Sounds a bit grand - but it is inspiring and helps keep life in perspective.

name: Tranquil Room near City Centre
description:
The space
A quiet & comfortable single room, wifi facility, shared bathroom facilities, located In St Paul's. A perfect base to explore Bristol, close to Stokes Croft, Cabot Circus, 20 minutes walking distance of train and bus stations.

This single room overlooks a small courtyard garden, has a comfortable bed, desk, wardrobe space. It is one of three bedrooms in a terraced house.

On the ground floor, there is a kitchen/dining room leading into a conservatory that opens onto a sunny courtyard garden. Just off the conservatory is a utilty room with the home's second toilet & basin, washing machine.

On the first floor, hallway, single bedroom, double bedroom, bathroom with walkin shower, separate bath, toilet, basin

Located in a welcoming community there are plenty of great local amenities near by. Bristol Templemeads & Montpelier train stations are a short distance away, 20minutes walk. The Central Bus Station is 15 - 20 minute
host_about:
My name is Joanne. I am from New Zealand and have been living in the UK for over thirty years, living in London for 15 years before settling here in Bristol for twenty years now. 

In 2013  I joined the Airbnb Community offering homestay accommodation to travellers & visitors, university students, those looking to relocate and or work in Bristol for short stay visits. 

My previous experience of homestay hosting involved working closely with an established Bristol English Language School, 2010 -2013. I was valued by them for my contribution to homestay experiences offered to their foreign language students. 

With the unprecedented events of the 2020 Covid 19 Pandemic, I closed my doors to hosting from March 2020 until  
June 2021. The three lockdown phases, in particular, though challenging at times, offered me & I hope others some extraordinary experiences, a time to pause, reflect, restore, regroup. So much to fathom during them & in the uncertain times we now continue to face. Gentle, gentle. 

It was with some reticence I concede, that I opened my doors to hosting again in the last weeks of June 2021. I am rediscovering again the enriching experience of sharing my home, creating a welcoming, relaxed & comfortable experience for others, a space where connecting in good conversation is valued & respected as much as the need for privacy & discretion. 

I feel immense gratitude for the experiences I have shared & been privilege to with guests through Airbnb hosting & I look forward to the many more experiences to come my way. 
With much warmth & appreciation, Joanne

name: Lovely quiet, clean, Double Bed+Single, with tv
description:
“Maggie is an experienced host so everything is pretty much bang on. Stayed before and will stay again.!”
So, do come here! ... to find comfy beds, good linen and towels, in a quiet, clean and welcoming environment: wifi, hairdryer, tea and coffee in each of the three bedrooms I let in my Victorian terraced house. This room has a double bed, a single bed and cable tv.

The space
The location is great for people working in the city or in the Filton and Abbeywood areas, UWE, MOD. The house is near Junction 2 of the M32 and street parking is free in Greenbank (a rarity in Bristol).

Also, because there is the fabulous Greenbank pub and many, many great eateries nearby, you can have a life as well as work. There are 4 places to do yoga within 5 minutes' walk, so the healthy folk are catered for, too.

•High speed wifi
•Tv with cable channels and radio
•Kettle, water bottle
•Tea, coffee, herb teas, milk, sugar, biscuits
•H
neighborhood_overview:
Incredibly convenient for business or pleasure, Greenbank, Bristol is just off the M32 so perfect for UWE, Filton, Frenchay and Southmead. There is unrestricted parking on the street here.
Pop into the city on the frequent buses (15 minutes), by local train - the Severn Beach Line - or whip down the Bristol Bath Railway/cycle track; a late night taxi back from the centre is about £9. Cyclists - there is space to safely park your bike.

TIMES ARE CHANGING. You will always find good food in this part of Bristol, even though some places have changed their times of opening. Check with me and on websites and social media for updates.
EATERIES We are spoilt for choice with ESTE KITCHEN next door (the cakes, the cakes!), the new gorgeous DELA restaurant 3 minutes away. On popular ST. MARK'S ROAD, a little skip away, you will find the new MASALA LIBRARY restaurant as well as the famous THALI, the delightful cafe & deli at NO. 12, next to the train station. And then there's
host_about:
Hi and thanks for looking at my profile and rooms. I’ve been offering accommodation with Airbnb since 2011 and love meeting all the different people who come to stay.

I welcome Airbnb visitors to my three spare bedrooms on a room-only basis. There is tea, coffee, and high speed wifi as well as cable tv, microwave and minifridge especially for guests. 

My visitors come to this thriving city on holiday, for weddings, and many stay for work commitments.   I'll help you get around and find what you need in this lovely corner of England.  It has been a great pleasure to host guests from all over the world.  I find that Airbnb guests enjoy the informality of staying in a home rather than a hotel.

My passion is tango and also teaching a breathing method called Buteyko, which has helped me overcome lifelong asthma.

If you have any questions about my listings please do get in touch.
best wishes and good hunting!
Maggie

name: Lovely quiet, clean, cosy room, Double Bed, tv
description:
"First time using Airb&b usually opt in for hotel stays but so glad I didn't this time. Maggie place was lovely, clean rooms, fresh bedding towels etc, perfectly situated for me, just outside town centre, close to all travel links."

So, do come here! ... to find comfy beds, good linen and towels, in a quiet, clean and welcoming environment with wifi, hairdryer, tea and coffee in each of the three bedrooms in my Victorian terraced house. Room 2 has a double bed, cable tv and a garden view.
neighborhood_overview:
Incredibly convenient for business or pleasure, Greenbank, Bristol is just off the M32 so perfect for UWE, Filton, Frenchay and Southmead. There is unrestricted parking on the street here. Pop into the city on the frequent buses (15 minutes), by local train - the Severn Beach Line - or whip down the Bristol Bath cycle track; a late night taxi back from the centre is just £8. Cyclists - there is space to safely park your bike.

EATERIES We are spoilt for choice with ESTE KITCHEN next door (the cakes, the cakes!), and the restaurants on popular ST. MARK'S ROAD, a little skip away. You will find the excellent MASALA LIBRARY restaurant there, as well as the famous THALI, the delightful cafe & deli at NO. 12, next to the train station. And then there's also the Swagatan and Bangladeshi restaurants. People come from far and wide to shop at the SWEETMART on St. Mark's Road and it now has take-away food and a deli.
You mustn't miss the historic GREENBANK PUB: fabulous pizza

I welcome Airbnb visitors to my three spare bedrooms on a room-only basis. There is tea, coffee, and high speed wifi as well as cable tv, microwave and minifridge especially for guests. 

My visitors come to this thriving city on holiday, for weddings, and many stay for work commitments.   I'll help you get around and find what you need in this lovely corner of England.  It has been a great pleasure to host guests from all over the world.  I find that Airbnb guests enjoy the informality of staying in a home rather than a hotel.

If you have any questions about my listings please do get in touch.
best wishes and good hunting!
Maggie

name: Private room in ‘Garden Square' Georgian townhouse
description:
Single (or cramped double) room in very quiet 'garden square' Georgian town house in Clifton, 5 minutes' walk from Clifton Village and the Supension Bridge (far enough to ensure a quiet night's sleep!).
If there are two of you, please don’t request to book for more than a weekend or a few nights as the room isn’t big enough-sorry!

The space
Your bedroom and bathroom are on the ground floor at the back of the house and they look out onto our small courtyard garden and the garage. You are three floors away from our bedroom and bathroom. As a result it is very quiet at night. Your bed has a pocket sprung and latex topped mattress and is very comfortable, so you should get some great sleep.
You have your own travertine marble tiled bathroom with a shower and underfloor heating.

Guest access
Private shower room (loo occasionally used by family).
Independent fridge/food storage and limited cooking facilities, with shared use o
neighborhood_overview: Our house is unusual in that there's a communal garden at the front, with no access by road, and a cul-de-sac at the back, so we have no passing traffic at all.  Clifton village, full of life, shops, restaurants, bars etc is a short but strenuous walk up the hill.
host_about: We're a busy, active family of two lawyers, two children (off at university now) and a lively working cocker spaniel. Both keen skiers and open water swimmers, Anne is a runner and Iain a mountain-biker. There are more bikes in the garage than people in the house ...

name: Beautiful big, quiet room w/ luxe bed + desk
description:
The space
Master bedroom of my Edwardian house in the very lovely and quiet Somerset Road in Totterdown, newly carpeted and freshly decorated. A very spacious (4.7x4.2m), and light, peaceful large double room in a very quiet street, with a super comfortable wrought iron framed king sized bed, complete with wool topped deep pocket sprung mattress. Blackout blinds and heavy velvet curtains, and double glazing ensure you a good night's sleep. Recently repainted in Farrow & Ball dark teal paint, the room also has a desk and chair with desk light, good sized chest of drawers and storage, bedside tables and touch-sensitive dimmer lights, as well as a vintage chaise longue, for stylish reclining, as well as a full length mirror. Sockets have additional USB outlets for easy charging of devices. There is an original cast iron fireplace, but this is purely decorative.

The house has a large open plan living room/dining room with comfy chairs and sofa, and a large and well a
neighborhood_overview: Quiet and very friendly, with a great community feel. It's a very peaceful neighbourhood, but with excellent access to the city, and great transport links of all kinds.
host_about: I'm a freelance media producer, so a lot of the time I'm working from home. I'm also a musician, photographer, cook, writer, philosopher and all round renaissance man! Lived in Bristol for 25 years, and it's a city I love and I know well, so if you're new to town I can give you some tips for finding interesting and uniquely Bristol-style culture.

name: Twin/Super King size bed, Shirehampton, Bristol
description:
Twin or super king size beds in a spacious, dual aspect, light and airy bedroom on the 1st floor of a large, modern family home. Lovely views of Penny Brohn park lands across the Avon river valley. Both windows have black out curtains and there is a TV and work desk.

The space
The room is on the 1st floor, along with the kitchen diner, lounge area and bathroom. There is one other Airbnb rooms on this floor, so you may be sharing the facilities with other guests.

Guest access
Your access to the property is through the front door , across the hallway and up the stairs to the 1st floor, the room is situated at the end of the landing adjacent to the kitchen.

Other things to note
I will give you keys for your room and a fob for the electric gates, when you leave you can pop them in the post box
neighborhood_overview:
We have great transport links from Shirehampton Station to Bristol and Weston Super Mare via the Severn Beach train line, Avonmouth Park and Ride, the green bus, stops a 3 minutes' walk away and there are frequent buses from the high street in Shirehampton village to Bristol City centre and Cribbs Causeway.
There are local shops, pubs and takeaway within walking distance.
We are blessed with some wonderful views of the river Avon along Lamplighters marshes and Daisy Fields just a short walk away.
host_about: I have lived in Shirhampton since June 2019, I share the house with a lodger, my 2 children, 3 cats and 8 rescue hens. I have a background in hospitality and take pride in providing a pleasent place to stay. Where possible my inpact on the environment is minimised.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Quiet Double With Ensuite In An Old Jeweller Shop
description:
Well-equipped double with en-suite (shower, bath, washbasin) at the rear of the house. Close to the garden, it has a cosy feel and is quiet at night, despite its central location.

Accessible only for guests pre-booked online - no extra people on the day. And no clubbers please - return time is 11pm, in respect to other guests.

The space
Located in an old jewellers shop, the modern, quirky decor, and upside-down layout gives this place a unique feel. Upstairs is great for socialising as the kitchen is the heart of the house. Downstairs there's the solitude to get away from it all.

It’s a lovely area to stay - great neighbours, restaurants, cafes, delis, farmshop, yoga studio, pharmacy, pubs, bakery and convenience store give the street its own micro-community.

At night the street can be busy, giving it a vibrant atmosphere. And if you want to get away from it all, downstairs is quiet and peaceful.

There's a garden an
neighborhood_overview:
A bohemian, old fashioned street with everything you need within 30 seconds walk!

It is in a vibrant part of the City famed for having the longest street of independent traders in Western Europe.
host_about: Outgoing, adventurous and relatively creative (all in the eye of the beholder right?!) I work hard and live life to the full. Welcome to my humble abode!

name: Excellent central location, perfect for visitors
description:
A large, well-presented king sized bedroom with fridge, microwave and tea and coffee making facilities in a central location with great transport links, fabulous fast free internet, a private walled garden, fully equipped, clean and comfortable living space and two exceptionally friendly small dogs to share it with!

If you are a visitor to our beautiful city, you'll find it convenient and great for your budget that cereals, toast, tea and coffee are provided gratis for you to start your day.

The space
Victorian terraced house, modern decoration, clean and tidy with friendly vibe. Your bedroom is a spacious double with a kingsized bed with a brand new mattress, desk, drawers, wardrobe and shelving. The room has its own fridge, kettle and microwave for your convenience. There is a 32 inch TV in the bedroom with a DVD player and free access through NOWTV to Sky Entertainment (including many boxsets) and catch up TV such as BBC iPlayer. Free wifi througho
neighborhood_overview:
This is a vibrant, evolving community with people from all cultures and influences. It's not a beautiful area by any means, so if you want a quiet, leafy suburb, this isn't for you. If you're after an inner-city, conveniently located place, close to the town and to train, coach and motorway, then this fits the bill. We are only a 12 minute walk to the shopping centre (Broadmead and Cabot Circus) where there is a large cinema and many restaurants. Away from town there is a road called St Mark's Road which has many lovely eating places.
Try the Greenbank, Volunteer Tavern or Phoenix pubs which are all a short distance away.
host_about:
Friendly, funny, considerate and kind, very laidback and happy and comfortable with people of all orientations and cultures.

I love travelling and have been fortunate enough to visit many different places, my current favourites being New Zealand and Myanmar. I love to read and to go to the opera and theatre when I have a chance. I enjoy socialising with friends and spending lots of time with my little dogs.

I think Airbnb is such a great idea, not only to make or to save a little money but also to meet lots of interesting people from all over the world and to help them explore and discover the amazing city of Bristol.
I'm happy to help you with advice on where to go and what to see, both in Bristol and throughout the country.
